page.title: 02The Ecology
page.content: A low ridge in the east looks down onto a broad shallow valley carrying theStaffs-Worcs canal. The western hills are divided by Smestow Brook and a small dip between Seisdon and Trescott. The underlying geology is mainly Bunter Sandstone with some Keuper sandstone capping the Orton Hills. To the north of Wombourne, Boulder Clay can be found along with many "erratic" stones. There are some alluvial deposits in the valley. The climate is generally moderate, although temperatures of -13 C (1940 & 1963) and 32 C (1943) have been recorded. It doesn't often reach these extremes. The rainfall is about 27 inches per year on average.
